summary.para: Returned from the FSCTL_LOOKUP_STREAM_FROM_CLUSTER control code. Zero or more of these structures follow the
structure in the output buffer returned.

remarks.para: The name in the FileName member can be very long and in a format not recognized by a customer with the stream name and attribute type name following the filename. While it's appropriate to log the entire filename for diagnostic purposes, if it is to be presented to an end-user it should be reformatted to be more understandable (for example, remove the attribute type name and if the Flags
member has any flag other than LOOKUP_STREAM_FROM_CLUSTER_ENTRY_ATTRIBUTE_DATA set then an appropriate message should be displayed.

summary.para: Offset in bytes from the beginning of this structure to the next LOOKUP_STREAM_FROM_CLUSTER_ENTRY
structure returned. If there are no more entries, this value is zero.

Flags describing characteristics about this stream. The value will consist of one or more of these values. At least one of the LOOKUP_STREAM_FROM_CLUSTER_ENTRY_ATTRIBUTE_* values that fall within the LOOKUP_STREAM_FROM_CLUSTER_ENTRY_ATTRIBUTE_MASK (0xff000000) will be set; one or more of the other flag values may be set.

description.para: The stream is part of the system pagefile.
The stream is locked from defragmentation. The HandleInfo member of the structure for this stream has the MARK_HANDLE_PROTECT_CLUSTERS flag set.
The stream is part of a file that is internal to the filesystem.
The stream is part of a file that is internal to TxF.
The stream is part of a $DATA attribute for the file (data stream).
The stream is part of the $INDEX_ALLOCATION attribute for the file.
The stream is part of another attribute for the file.

summary.para: This value is reserved and is currently zero.
This is the cluster that this entry refers to. It will be one of the clusters passed in the input structure.

A NULL-terminated Unicode string containing the path of the object relative to the root of the volume. This string will refer to the attribute or stream represented by the cluster. This string is not limited by MAX_PATH and may be up to 32,768 characters (65,536 bytes) in length. Not all of the filenames returned can be opened; some are internal to NTFS and always opened exclusively. The string returned includes the full path including filename, stream name, and attribute type name in the form "full\path\to\file\filename.ext:streamname:typename".
